Event.name: Endeavor_failure
Event.definition:
<def-root>Some individual or group ceases to be able to sustain an <fen>Endeavor</fen> (a long-term activity involving economic interaction with the public, often a business venture).
Unlike Business_failure and Locale_closure, the <fen>Endeavor</fen> need not refer to an organization or business tied to a specific location or locations.
<ex><fex name="end">Exxon</fex> <t>went under</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Endeavor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Endeavor</fen> is rendered unable to continue its regular operations.
<ex><fex name="end">His small business</fex> <t>failed</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is named as one of the causes of failure.
<ex><fex name="end">The local McDonalds</fex> <t>shut down</t> in 2008 <fex name="exp">because the owner died</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> of the failure.
<ex><fex name="end">Her campaign</fex> <t>failed</t> <fex name="tim">in 2008</fex> but found much more support in 2012.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> of the failing <fen>Endeavor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="end">The hot dog stand</fex> <fex name="pla">on 4th avenue</fex> <t>flopped</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> that caused failure. Compared to <fen>Explanation</fen>, this describes situations or environments that lead to failure, not a specific reason for failure.
<ex><fex name="end">Shops</fex> often <t>close down</t> <fex name="cir">amid political or economic chaos</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the <fen>Endeavor</fen> failed.
<ex><fex name="exp">Because of its lack of funding</fex>, <fex name="end">the website</fex> <fex name="man">quickly</fex> <t>flopped</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Containing_event</fen> is an event within which the failure occurs.
<ex><fex name="end">Businesses</fex> <fex name="pla">in the Congo</fex> <t>failed</t> <fex name="Containing_event">during the civil war</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Depictive</fen> describes something about the <fen>Endeavor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="end">The business</fex>, <fex name="dep">unable to maintain appeal in the E.U.</fex>, <t>closed its doors</t> <fex name="tim">in 2003</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fail.v
lexUnit.definition: An endeavor seaces to be feasible.

lexUnit.name: collapse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Fall apart metaphorically so as to be unable to continue operation.

lexUnit.name: fold.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: An entity, usually a business, ceases to operate.

lexUnit.name: go under.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: A business ceases to operate.

lexUnit.name: go bust.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: A business entity becomes bankrupt.
